segment.source: Configuring Certificates to Support Secure Streaming
segment.target: Configuring Certificates to Support Secure Streaming

segment.source: Configuring Certificates to Support Secure Streaming
segment.target: Configuring Certificates to Support Secure Streaming

segment.source: Configuring Certificates to Support Secure Streaming
segment.target: Configuring Certificates to Support Secure Streaming

segment.source: By default, the App-V service runs under the Network Service account.
segment.target: By default, the App-V service runs under the Network Service account.

segment.source: However, you can create a service account in Active Directory Domain Services and replace the Network Service account with the Active Directory Domain account.
segment.target: However, you can create a service account in Active Directory Domain Services and replace the Network Service account with the Active Directory Domain account.

segment.source: The security context under which the service runs is important for configuring enhanced secure communications.
segment.target: The security context under which the service runs is important for configuring enhanced secure communications.

segment.source: This security context must have read permissions for the certificate private key.
segment.target: This security context must have read permissions for the certificate private key.

segment.source: When a PKCS10 Certificate Signing Request (CSR) is generated for the App-V server, the Windows Cryptographic Service Provider is called and a private key is generated.
segment.target: When a PKCS10 Certificate Signing Request (CSR) is generated for the App-V server, the Windows Cryptographic Service Provider is called and a private key is generated.

segment.source: The private key is secured with permissions given to the System and Administrator accounts only.
segment.target: The private key is secured with permissions given to the System and Administrator accounts only.

segment.source: You must modify the access control lists (ACLs) on the private key to let the App-V Management or Streaming Server access the private key required for successful TLS secured communication.
segment.target: You must modify the access control lists (ACLs) on the private key to let the App-V Management or Streaming Server access the private key required for successful TLS secured communication.

segment.source: Obtaining and Installing a Certificate
segment.target: Obtaining and Installing a Certificate

segment.source: The scenarios for obtaining and installing a certificate for App-V are as follows:
segment.target: The scenarios for obtaining and installing a certificate for App-V are as follows:

segment.source: Internal public key infrastructure (PKI).
segment.target: Internal public key infrastructure (PKI).

segment.source: Third-party certificate issuing certification authority (CA).
segment.target: Third-party certificate issuing certification authority (CA).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you need to obtain a certificate from a third-party CA, follow the documentation available on that CA’s Web site.
segment.target: If you need to obtain a certificate from a third-party CA, follow the documentation available on that CA’s Web site.

segment.source: If a PKI infrastructure has been deployed, consult with the PKI administrators to acquire a certificate that complies with the requirements described in this topic.
segment.target: If a PKI infrastructure has been deployed, consult with the PKI administrators to acquire a certificate that complies with the requirements described in this topic.

segment.source: If a PKI infrastructure is not available, use a third-party CA to obtain a valid certificate.
segment.target: If a PKI infrastructure is not available, use a third-party CA to obtain a valid certificate.

segment.source: For step-by-step guidance for obtaining and installing a certificate, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151969.
segment.target: For step-by-step guidance for obtaining and installing a certificate, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151969.
